get.description: Returns all calendar items created by current user or shared with him

post.description:
Creates new calendar item.

Examples:

**E.B. choir practice weekdays at 5:30pm:**

*Event object properties:*
- **title**: E.B. choir practice
- **starts_at:** 5:30pm with date
- **event_recurrences_attributes**: array of EventReccurenceInput objects
  with following day property values: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5

username.description: User's email. Required if grant_type is password

password.description: User's password. Required if grant_type is password

scope.description: Authorisation scope. Can be sent if grant_type is password. = ['user' or 'admin']

refresh_token.description: User's refresh token. Required if grant_type is refresh_token
Uniq refresh_token, can be used when access_token expires

read_only.description: Specifies if calendar read only or not

visible.description: Specifies if calendar visible in UI

user_id.description: User ID who created this event

starts_at.description: Start date and time for event

ends_at.description: End date and time for event

all_day.description: Specifies all-day event. If it's true so ends_at is being set to null

timezone_name.description: Optional time zone to apply to starting and ending dates. For reminders time zone usually does not matter

starts_at.description: Start date and time for event

ends_at.description: End date and time for event

all_day.description: Specifies all-day event. If it's true so ends_at is being set to null

timezone_name.description: Optional time zone to apply to starting and ending dates. For reminders time zone usually does not matter

kind.description: Enumeration specifies the type of event

location_name.description: Location name. It might be city name, neighborhood name or anything else

separation.description: The number of intervals at en event's frequency in between occurrences of the event. For instance, if an event occurs every other week, it has a frequency of weekly and a separation of 2 because there are 2 weeks in between occurrences. This property defaults to 1

count.description: Specifies a limit number of times the event will occur. Set this property to NULL for no limit

until.description: Specifies a limiting date and time after which no recurrences will be generated for this event. Set this property to NULL for no limit

frequency.description: This property specifies the frequency at which this event recurs. Possible values are 'once', 'daily', 'weekly', 'monthly', and 'yearly'

day.description:
"For weekly recurring events:
  the day of the week the event occurs.
  0 = Sunday, 1 = Monday, ..., 6 = Saturday.
For monthly recurring events:
  if the week property is NULL, the day property specifies the day of the
  month that the event occurs. If the week property is non-NULL, the day
  property specifies the day of the week that the event occurs in that week
  of the month."

week.description:
"For weekly recurring events:
  these properties should be set to NULL for weekly recurring events.
  Setting these properties to non-NULL values will cause unspecified results.
For yearly recurring events:
  the usage for the week and day properties of a yearly recurring event are
  exactly the same as their usage for monthly recurring events."

month.description:
"For monthly recurring events:
  this property should be set to NULL for monthly recurring events.
  Setting this property to a non-NULL value will cause unspecified results.
For yearly recurring events:
  if the month property is non-NULL, it specifies the month for which this
  pattern should be used. If it is NULL, this pattern will be for the
  month of the original date/time of the event."

day.description:
"For weekly recurring events:

For monthly recurring events:
  if the week property is NULL, the day property specifies the day of the

  property specifies the day of the week that the event occurs in that week
  of the month."

For yearly recurring events:
  the usage for the week and day properties of a yearly recurring event are
  exactly the same as their usage for monthly recurring events."

For yearly recurring events:
  if the month property is non-NULL, it specifies the month for which this
  pattern should be used. If it is NULL, this pattern will be for the
  month of the original date/time of the event."

EventCancellationInput.description: Specifies a date when event shall not occur or be canceled

date.description:
the date of the recurrence of an event which should be cancelled. If the
event spans multiple days, this column should be set to the first date on
which the recurrence to be cancelled falls

uploaded_file_id.description: ID of file which was uploaded earlier

user_id.description: User ID who created this list

order.description: Sorting order for item in the list

done.description: Shows whether user finished with this item or not

readOnly.description: Specifies if this is read only share

sharedItem.description: Item to be shared. It should be only one item - calendar, calendar group, calendar item, document or list

calendar.description: Optional calendar ID to be shared

calendarGroup.description: Optional calendar group ID to be shared

calendarItem.description: Optional calendar item ID to be shared

document.description: Optional document ID to be shared

list.description: Optional list ID to be shared
